Description: Fragment of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Lip, neck and oval handle to moderate turn. Rectangular stamp. Clay fine light pink-brown; cream slip. Traces of red paint..
Production date: 211 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes (2015) 142.)
Curator's comments: Drawn by Petrie (Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p.110, 34). From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0187.19 (which has wrong reading in text). Name Xenostratos.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0655)
